text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron veitchianum is a rhododendron species native to Burma, Thailand, and Laos, where it grows at altitudes of 900–2400 meters. It is a shrub that grows to 2–3 m in height, with leaves that are obovate or narrowly elliptic, 65-100 x 28–40 mm in size. Flowers are fragrant and white, often with a yellow blotch at the base.
text.Synonyms:
Azalea veitchiana
Rhododendron cubittii
Rhododendron smilesii
text.References:
Bot. Mag. 83: t. 4992. 1857.
